file_content.text: Ah yes, I can sense the new power within you. Good. Then I would suggest--
Master, enough of this. You are full to bursting. Strike now before your enemy makes another move.
For once, I agree with the monster. Break into Thanaton's meditation chamber and blast him with all those dead Sith you've piled up.
Then set a course for Dromund Kaas.
Agreed.
You got it, Captain.
Where's this meditation chamber again?
How do I get to him?
Dromund Kaas. The Citadel. You say the word, I'll set the course.
The ghosts don't do anything. It's just raw power.
It doesn't work that way.
However it works. So long as Thanaton's dead when you're done.
But if you face him with his defenses up like last time, you're toast. Don't forget it.
If there's any way I can aid you, my lord, let me know.
My lightsaber is ready, should you have need.
Thanaton will make an excellent meal.
I trust our friend Harkun is doing well?
If your business is finished on Korriban, it's time we looked for another spirit to bind.
Tell me about this ghost.
You have my attention.
If it were up to me, we'd attack Thanaton now.
Do we need another ghost?
I don't think that's a good idea.
We've had this discussion before.
Thanaton will not be caught off guard this time. You must shore up enough power to destroy him.
I hope you've turned up more than rumors.
You mean Hoth.
One man's rumors are another man's Force-fortifying ghosts.
We think what Andronikos has heard is true.
A Republic transport crashed over Hoth about a year ago. It was carrying artifacts from a Sith tomb that the Jedi had confiscated.
You think they got the tomb's chief resident as well?
Artifacts and a ghost?
More likely than not.
Confiscated is the perfect euphemism, isn't it?
You mean robbed.
A Sith is in no place to judge.
What did the Jedi want with Sith artifacts?
Why did the Jedi take them?
What does it matter? They never reached their destination.
The Jedi never recovered the transport. I don't like the idea of binding the dead like this, but if you have to, I'd start looking for that transport.
Your old apprentices are dead, but they managed to steal the key to Thanaton's meditation chamber.
And so goes the last of my legacy--yourself excepted. But this key, perhaps their death was not such a waste.
Thanaton's private mediation chamber would be the perfect place for an ambush.
We done playing with ghosts yet? Where I come from, man takes your dignity, you break his teeth.
We shouldn't rush to seek revenge.
We can't afford haste. I'd advise against facing Thanaton until you've gained more power.
He killed my apprentices--your apprentices. Whatever. I will crush him!
I want him dead.
How do I do that? I don't know where any more ghosts are.
What's your advice?
We need to find another ghost.
Let's get going.
Y'know, it's just hearsay, but there've been strange rumors coming off Hoth lately. Ships crashing mysteriously, crews hearing voices.
Some pretty level-headed people I know are spooked.
Ashara and I will look into these Hoth rumors. In the meantime, you should consider replacing your apprentices.
You will appear weak if you don't try to restore what Thanaton destroyed. I've heard a new group of acolytes have arrived on Korriban.
Slaves. The kind that Thanaton always passes on. Our old friend Harkun is training them.
It will be wonderful to see Harkun again.
Excellent.
I already have an apprentice.
What's wrong with Ashara?
Thanaton took two apprentices from you. And fallen or not, this one can hardly be called Sith.
You should have let me kill that imbecile when we had the chance.
I spit on Harkun.
He can be difficult to suffer at times, but he may yet prove useful to you.
An apprentice from Korriban is a special honor. It says you have status, and you will have your pick of the group.
Go to Korriban while we study these Hoth rumors your pirate friend produced.
My lord, you're back!
Thought you were gone. Guy could get trampled by a bantha herd and not get knocked around as bad as you.
We followed Thanaton's servants, cut them down and pulled you out of a ditch.
You didn't have a pulse at first, but then Kaal noticed you were still warm. I don't know how you survived that.
That explains why I'm still alive. Where's Thanaton?
What about Thanaton?
You sure you're ready to face him? He did a real number on you.
I thought these spirits were supposed to protect me.
What happened?
That's the remarkable part. As far as I can tell, they did.
I guess I should thank you, then.
I owe you.
You are our master, my lord. Without you, we are orphans.
Your survival is the most remarkable thing I've ever witnessed. I still can't quite figure it out.
It seems Thanaton's ritual was too powerful for your shield, but he didn't fully understand the bond between you and the dead.
To kill you, he would've had to purge their spirits. You died, and their very presence kept you alive.
That's great, but what do we do? We can't wait for Thanaton to come back and kill us.
I'll find the most powerful dead in the galaxy, bind them, and take their power. Thanaton won't stand a chance.
Power first, then revenge.
Zash, do you know of any powerful artifacts or rituals we could use to defeat Thanaton?
Any ideas, Zash?
Thanaton guards those secrets jealously, and he took most of my research after I was... after the incident.
If only we knew Thanaton's vulnerability... he's not part cyborg by any chance?
Does Thanaton have a weakness?
No, Thanaton despises modification of that kind. He only defended Skotia because he liked me less.
We need to make it so that Thanaton can't break through your shield.
Corrin's right. His servants said he looked pretty drained after he knocked you out. Just a little more power....
It's a gamble. None of us know what the cost of acquiring so much power so quickly could be.
I'm well aware of the cost, but I'll risk it.
I'll take my chances.
We don't exactly have other options, do we?
Do you have an alternative?
Exactly. Better to do something than sit here and wait to be killed.
I've bound two so far and nothing's gone wrong yet.
Don't worry about me.
Suit yourself. But as you know--rituals don't always go as planned.
So where do we find more ghosts?
The Jedi on Taris were investigating something of that nature; I sent a man to investigate shortly before my unfortunate change.
I'd have to do more research on the matter to confirm, but I suggest making contact with him.
One won't be enough. When I face Thanaton again, I want to crush him.
We need more.
I will.
Doesn't anyone have anything more... solid?
You're all useless.
I wish we had more to go on, but right now, that's all I have.
Corrin and I will dig around too--and we'll keep an eye on Thanaton. If he makes a move, we'll let you know. Good luck, my lord.
